page.title: 12Cattle Breeds at Market
page.content:
Government restrictions on milk production has caused farmers not to want dairy cattle. They are sold at the market but with bull calves to rear as Store Cattle. Cattle for beef creates the best sale. Breeds at the market were{Hereford, Aberdeen Angus, {S.Devon, Friesian}(British) and {Charolais, Simmental}(Continental). The following are animal numbers sold on one market day in June,the coloured numbers indicate the market's capacity
Store Cattle..... 300 {( 500) Fat Cattle....... 250 { ( 400) Calves...........200-300 {(1400) Sheep............ 900 {(1300) Pigs.............100-200{ ( 300) { Calf Â£25-Â£150 each: Sheep Â£30-Â£40 each Fat Cattle Â£1 per kg Auctioneer's commission 2%
